      • combinePixels

        public static int combinePixels(int rgb1,
                int rgb2,
                int operation,
                int extraAlpha)
        Combine pixels using the specified operation
        Parameters:
        rgb1 - first pixel to combine
        rgb2 - second pixel to combine
        operation - see NORMAL , MIN, MAX, MAX , ADD,SUBTRACT , DIFFERENCE, DISSOLVE , DST_IN, MULTIPLY, AVERAGE,ALPHA_TO_GRAY and so on.
        extraAlpha - level of alpha to extract. Maximum value: 255, Min Value:0
        Returns:

      • adjustBrightness

        public static int adjustBrightness(int argb,
                   int percent)
        Change the brightness of a color
        Parameters:
        argb -
        percent - to increase brightness. Negative value indicates decrease brightness
        Returns:
        Hex color with the adjusted brightness

      • getDistance

        public static double getDistance(int r1,
                 int g1,
                 int b1,
                 int r2,
                 int g2,
                 int b2)
        Get the distance between two colors
        Parameters:
        r1 - Red component of the first color
        g1 - Green component of the first color
        b1 - Blue component of the first color
        r2 - Red component of the second color
        g2 - Green component of the second color
        b2 - Blue component of the second color
        Returns:
        Distance bwetween colors

      • getGradient

        public static final int[] getGradient(int startColor,
                int endColor,
                int steps)
        Creates a gradient of colors. This method is highly optimized and only uses bit-shifting and additions (no multitplication nor devision), but it will create a new integer array in each call.
        Parameters:
        startColor - the first color
        endColor - the last color
        steps - the number of colors in the gradient, when 2 is given, the first one will be the startColor and the second one will the endColor.
        Returns:
        an int array with the gradient.

      • getGradient

        public static final void getGradient(int startColor,
               int endColor,
               int[] gradient)
        Creates a gradient of colors. This method is highly optimized and only uses bit-shifting and additions (no multitplication nor devision).
        Parameters:
        startColor - The first color
        endColor - The last color
        gradient - The array in which the gradient colors are stored. length of the array is the number of steps used in the gradient

      • isDark

        public static boolean isDark(int argb)
        Check if a color is more dark than light. Useful if an entity of this color is to be labeled: Use white label on a "dark" color and black label on a "light" color.
        Parameters:
        argb - Color to check.
        Returns:
        True if this is a "dark" color, false otherwise.

      • isDark

        public static boolean isDark(int r,
             int g,
             int b)
        Check if a color is more dark than light. Useful if an entity of this color is to be labeled: Use white label on a "dark" color and black label on a "light" color.
        Parameters:
        r - ,g,b Color to check.
        Returns:
        True if this is a "dark" color, false otherwise.

        public static int setLuminosity(int argb,

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setSaturation

        public static int setSaturation(int argb,
                int percent)
        Set the saturation for a given color

        The saturation of a color is determined by a combination of light intensity and how much it is distributed across the spectrum of different wavelengths.
        Scale of saturation (0% at bottom).

        Parameters:
        argb - argb value
        percent - percent always less than or equal to 100
        Returns:
        color with the set saturation level

      • setTransparency

        Parameters:

        level - 0(fully transparent) to 255(fully opaque)
        Returns:
